column4: Hi all , i installed limewire via deb file and now im unable to uninstall it . can some help?
You should be able to find and remove it with Synaptic.
No , i cant
ysis:Searching in synaptic gave no results
do you still have the .deb file?
: no :\
Can you download it again? Then just double-click on it. This should give you a popup where you can hit a deinstallation button.
ysis:i'll search for it again
ysis:also tried to dkpg -r limewire
i'llgo find it.
I could always deinstall via Synaptic when I installed with this debi package manager thingy.
Ok found it , 80%....
Is it working?
when i open the deb i can only see Reinstall Package
Sorry, I was mistaken. Try this: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=474610
But you need to know the package name.
the name of the package is limewire-basic , so i can apt-get remove it no?
RanyAlbec: Just try 'sudo apt-get remove limewire-basic' then.
Or look for it in the synaptic package manager.
Not the Add/Remove.. thingy
!hi | bond__
thanks. that is done . but i still see the .limewire dir on my home folder
should i just remove it?
That's where your configuration files are. If you plan on reinstalling later leave it.
